`Registered Attendees (116)`

On August 24, 2025, **R-Ladies Rome** hosted **Interactive Quarto Dashboards**, a collaborative and beginner-friendly workshop led by **Derek Sollberger**, lecturer at the Center for Statistics and Machine Learning and Posit Certified Tidyverse Instructor.

##  📊 Workshop Overview

In this easy-going workshop, participants explored how to build **interactive web-based dashboards** that enable teams—whether in academic or business settings—to present information via multiple graphs and tables. The session covered techniques to **filter, sort, visualize data**, **uncover trends**, and present results with both function and aesthetic appeal using **R, Quarto, Shiny, Markdown,** and **geospatial data**. Some prior programming experience was helpful, though not required.

## 🧠 What You’ll Learn

- How to **assemble interactive dashboards** using Quarto and Shiny  
- Methods for **effective data presentation**: filtering, sorting, and trend exploration  
- Techniques for **adding geospatial data** and aesthetic polish to your dashboards

## 🔊 About the Speaker

[Derek Sollberger](https://www.linkedin.com/in/derek-sollberger/) is a lecturer at CSML (Center for Statistics and Machine Learning), specializing in Data Science, AI Methods, and Bayesian Analysis. A Posit Certified Tidyverse Instructor, Derek brings experience from leading R workshops and consulting on pedagogy-driven data projects.
